body_html:
You can find a version of the function _linear in an old version of tensorflow (check the older version branches). Copy and paste it into your own codebase and use it there. We will not be making it public.
…
On Thu, Jul 13, 2017 at 11:49 AM, tle4336 ***@***.***> wrote: @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo>: could you please help reopen linear? I am trying to execute the code provided here by Alex ( https://github.com/atpaino/deep-text-corrector), but I keep getting this error message: AttributeError: module 'tensorflow.python.ops.rnn_cell' has no attribute '_linear'. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
You can find a version of the function _linear in an old version of
tensorflow (check the older version branches).  Copy and paste it into your
own codebase and use it there.  We will not be making it public.

On Thu, Jul 13, 2017 at 11:49 AM, tle4336 <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo>: could you please help reopen
> linear? I am trying to execute the code provided here by Alex (
> https://github.com/atpaino/deep-text-corrector), but I keep getting this
> error message: AttributeError: module 'tensorflow.python.ops.rnn_cell'
> has no attribute '_linear'.
>
